fields.headline: Tours for serious swimmers
fields.bodyText: The first travel company dedicated to outdoor swimming holidays, Swim Trek (020 8696 0764), will be making its inaugural trip at the end of next month. Founder Simon Murie will run the first of four Turkish tours scheduled for this summer from 24 to 30 May. The tour follows in the wake of Lord Byron with a crossing of the 1,300-metre wide Hellespont, and swims from the beaches of Gallipoli and the ancient city of Troy. Other tours include the Scilly Isles; carving past the Corryvreckan whirlpool made famous by George Orwell in the Inner Hebrides; and a weekend taster across the Lake Dis trict. Murie, who will be taking the tours himself, said: 'When I got into open-water swimming myself, I looked for a company selling holidays that catered for it. There weren't any so I decided to set one up.' The tours are suitable for anyone who can swim the average daily distance of the tour, typically two miles (or 40 lengths of a pool) at a regular pace. Freestylers, breaststrokers, backstrokers and butterfliers are all welcome. Murie will teach the idiosyncrasies of outdoor swimming, mainly in increasing the efficiency of your stroke. But he adds: The emphasis of each tour is to make it a holiday and not an endurance event.' Typically, swimming will take up two hours of a day, and the rest will be spent walking, eating and drinking. All groups swim with a canoe or motorised escort, and in colder waters wetsuits are optional. Murie says: 'Nothing beats swimming outdoors.'
